title: Sweet and Sour Meatballs Recipe
description: Sweet and sour meatballs made with ground beef are simmered in a deliciously thick sweet-sour sauce. Serve over rice for a quick and easy dinner!
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Main Dishes Meatball Recipes Sweet and Sour Meatballs 4.5 (486) 387 Reviews 36 Photos This sweet and sour meatball recipe came from my mother-in-law. I got it shortly after I was married and now it is a favorite of our kids. I like to serve it over rice. Submitted by Cathy Updated on January 2, 2025 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 36 36 36 36 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 20 mins Servings: 5 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 5 servings Meatballs: 1 pound ground beef 1 cup dry bread crumbs 1 onion, chopped 1 egg salt and pepper to taste Sweet and Sour Sauce: 1 cup brown sugar 1 cup water ½ cup ketchup ½ cup cider vinegar 2 tablespoons soy sauce 2 tablespoons cornstarch Directions Make meatballs: Mix beef, bread crumbs, onion, egg, salt, and pepper together in a large bowl until well combined. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Shape mixture into 1 1/2-inch diameter balls. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cook meatballs in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat until evenly browned and cooked through. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Make sauce: Mix brown sugar, water, ketchup, vinegar, soy sauce, and cornstarch together in a medium bowl until smooth. Pour sauce over meatballs. Reduce heat to low and simmer until sauce is thick, 3 to 5 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve hot and enjoy! DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  I Made It Print 700 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 601 Calories 26g Fat 71g Carbs 20g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 5 Calories 601 % Daily Value * Total Fat 26g 34% Saturated Fat 10g 52% Cholesterol 114mg 38% Sodium 878mg 38% Total Carbohydrate 71g 26% Dietary Fiber 2g 5% Total Sugars 51g Protein 20g 41% Vitamin C 5mg 6% Calcium 102mg 8% Iron 4mg 19% Potassium 477mg 10% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Sweet and Sour Meatballs 01 of 36 Photo by  DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  02 of 36 Photo by  SweetLeek5821 11/18/2023 I found this recipe years ago and have made them often. I never had an issue with the way the meatballs turned out. Never stuck. The balls were firm. The sauce is very good. I use white vinegar and it tastes great still. My entire family loves these. 03 of 36 Photo by  VioletNut7452 01/15/2023 Absolutely delicious. Highly recommended. One batch on rice with steamed veg fed 3 people and had an extra portion left for leftovers. Prep time was much longer than 5 minutes but not an issue at all. 04 of 36 Photo by  GoofyPrune1935 11/17/2022 Loved it. I followed the recipe exactly and I used apple cider vinegar. Very happy and will definitely be making these again! 05 of 36 Photo by  Kara Tremblay 12/06/2021 Tangy, interesting. I used apple cider vinegar, by accident. Had to add extra cornstarch mixture to get it to thicken. 2/3 of us disliked it, 1/3 of us LOVED it. Mixed in some oven roasted peppers and onion and served it over basmati. 06 of 36 Photo by  Hlovell1977 05/04/2020 07 of 36 Photo by  Beth Moulton 02/28/2020 08 of 36 Photo by  Becky Rhodes Underhill 12/12/2019 09 of 36 Photo by  Fortune Goulais 08/28/2019 Delicious, now if I can figure out how to take a picture!! New favourite, and I used apple cider vinegar with mother, I added a taste of siracha and a taste of Frank's hot pepper sauce, those are the only changes I made, over rice and a salad on the side. Thank you so very much, really enjoyed making these!! 10 of 36 Photo by  OldBeforeMyTime 05/04/2019 this was far from the first time I've made this recipe and I love it every single time! I don't eat beef or pork so I make it with ground chicken or turkey instead. I didn't adjust a single thing when making it this time except for being a little short on cider vinegar so I topped it off with white vinegar. I couldn't tell the difference 1 2 3 4 Next You’ll Also Love Porcupines 521 Ratings American Chop Suey II 393 Ratings Gyros Burgers 295 Ratings The Best Meatballs You'll Ever Have 524 Ratings The Best Sweet and Sour Meatballs 807 Ratings Easy Porcupine Meatballs 124 Ratings Pepperoncini Beef 1,175 Ratings Cranberry Pot Roast 93 Ratings Cocktail Meatballs IV 226 Ratings Swedish Meatballs I 508 Ratings The Best Meatballs 1,666 Ratings Aunt Fannie's Dinner 242 Ratings Slow Cooker Roast Beef 706 Ratings Slow Cooked Corned Beef for Sandwiches 817 Ratings Corned Beef Hash 239 Ratings Kafta (BBQ) 155 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Cathy
instructions: Make meatballs: Mix beef, bread crumbs, onion, egg, salt, and pepper together in a large bowl until well combined. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Shape mixture into 1 1/2-inch diameter balls. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Cook meatballs in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat until evenly browned and cooked through. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Make sauce: Mix brown sugar, water, ketchup, vinegar, soy sauce, and cornstarch together in a medium bowl until smooth.;Pour sauce over meatballs. Reduce heat to low and simmer until sauce is thick, 3 to 5 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Serve hot and enjoy! DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS
